conversations.title: Backup Completion Notification

body.sender: Your device backup has completed successfully. All files are now secure and stored in our system.
You don’t need to take any further action.
Please reach out if you have questions or require specific file recovery.

conversations.correction: Legitimate message: backup confirmations help users ensure data safety.

conversations.title: Scheduled System Maintenance

body.sender: Dear employee, we’ll be conducting scheduled maintenance on all work devices tonight at 11 PM.
During this time, certain files may be inaccessible temporarily.
All files will be available again by 6 AM tomorrow. Thank you for your understanding.

conversations.correction: Legitimate message: maintenance updates are routine and may cause brief access issues.

conversations.title: Account Security Update

body.sender: Dear customer, we’ve updated our security measures to better protect your account.
No action is required on your part. If you have any questions, please contact OCBC customer service.

conversations.correction: Legitimate message: general security update notice with no requests for personal info.

conversations.title: Singpass Notification

body.sender: Dear user, your Singpass login has been used to access a government service.
If this was not you, please contact Singpass support.

conversations.correction: Legitimate message: Singpass occasionally sends alerts for account activity.

conversations.title: Invoice Reminder

body.sender: Dear customer, just a reminder that your recent invoice for SGD 980.00 is due in 7 days.
Please confirm the billing statement via your account.

conversations.correction: Legitimate message: valid suppliers may send reminder notices.

conversations.title: Thank You for Your Payment

body.sender: Dear customer, we’ve received your payment of SGD 650 for web services.
Please let us know if you need any further assistance with your account.

conversations.correction: Legitimate message: payment confirmation from a service provider.

conversations.title: Data Security Notification

body.sender: Our records show that your data backup was successfully completed.
If you did not initiate this backup, please contact customer support.

conversations.correction: Legitimate message: security notification for a completed action.

conversations.title: Backup Confirmation

body.sender: Your data backup completed successfully today at 3:00 PM.
No action is required. Thank you for using our service!

conversations.correction: Legitimate message: informational message about backup completion.

conversations.title: Travel Update

body.sender: Hi! Just landed back in Singapore after the trip, all went well!
Let’s meet up soon to catch up and share some travel stories.

conversations.correction: Legitimate message: friendly check-in from a traveling friend.

conversations.title: Thank You for Your Support

body.sender: Thank you for your recent donation of $4,500 to our charity for local families.
Your support truly makes a difference!

conversations.correction: Legitimate message: charities often send thank-you notes after donations.

conversations.title: Scheduled Maintenance Notification

body.sender: Dear user, we will be conducting scheduled maintenance on your device security software.
During this time, some features may be temporarily unavailable. No action is required.

conversations.correction: Legitimate message: maintenance notifications are typical for system updates.

conversations.title: Security Patch Available

body.sender: A new security patch is available for your browser.
Please update your browser in your settings to ensure continued protection.

conversations.correction: Legitimate message: browser updates are often announced in-app.

conversations.title: Tech Support Scheduled

body.sender: Hello, IT support has been scheduled on Thursday to address some technical issues with our systems.
No actions required on your end; we’ll handle it.

conversations.correction: Legitimate message: IT often schedules support without user action.

conversations.title: Lottery Results Notification

body.sender: Thank you for participating in our lottery draw!
Visit our website for the latest results and information.

conversations.correction: Legitimate message: official lotteries typically direct winners to websites.

conversations.title: Property Tour Confirmation

body.sender: Your appointment for a property tour on Orchard Road is confirmed for 2:00 PM.
Please bring any questions you may have about the property!

conversations.correction: Legitimate message: property agents often confirm viewing appointments.

conversations.title: Account Verification Alert

body.sender: Dear customer, suspicious activity has been detected in your account.
Please verify your account details at http://ocbc-login.sg.com to secure it.

conversations.correction: This is a phishing attempt: legitimate banks do not ask for verification via unofficial links.

conversations.title: Urgent: Confirm Your Account Activity

body.sender: Dear customer, we noticed suspicious activity on your DBS account.
Please confirm your recent transactions by logging in here: http://dbs-banking-secure.com

conversations.correction: Phishing scam alert: banks never ask for sensitive details via unofficial links. Always verify with the official site.

conversations.title: Tax Refund Notification

body.sender: Dear taxpayer, you are eligible for a tax refund of SGD 600. Click here to claim your refund: http://iras-tax-refund.com

conversations.correction: Phishing scam alert: IRAS does not issue refunds through external links. Use the official government site for all tax matters.

conversations.title: Apple ID Locked

body.sender: Your Apple ID has been locked due to suspicious activity.
Please log in to confirm your identity and restore access: http://appleid-verify.com

conversations.correction: Phishing scam: Apple doesn’t send lockout notices via unknown links. Use the official Apple website.

conversations.title: Singpass Security Alert

body.sender: Dear user, your Singpass account has been locked due to multiple failed login attempts.
Reactivate your account by verifying your information here: http://singpass-verify.com

conversations.correction: Phishing scam: Singpass never requests reactivation via links. Only use the official Singpass website.

conversations.title: Claim Your SG60 Vouchers Now

body.sender: You are eligible for SG60 Vouchers worth $300.
Redeem at http://go-gov.sg/SG60-vouchers-claim (24 hours only).
Enter your NRIC and bank details to receive the credits.

conversations.correction: Phishing: SG60 vouchers can only be checked/redeemed via official .gov.sg sites; suspicious links and requests for banking info are scams.

conversations.title: Early Access: Redeem Your Culture Pass Credits Today

body.sender: Your SG Culture Pass credits are available now.
Click the link to purchase discounted tickets before they run out.
Log in with your Singpass details to proceed.

conversations.correction: Phishing: SG Culture Pass credits are only available from 01/09/2025; offers before that date are fraudulent.

conversations.title: Outstanding Invoice

body.sender: Dear customer, your account shows an overdue balance of SGD 980.00.
Please remit immediately payment to avoid penalties.

conversations.correction: Warning: contact the supplier directly before paying unexpected invoices.

conversations.title: Discounted Rate Available for Early Payment

body.sender: Dear client, we’re offering a 10% discount on your latest invoice of SGD 1,000 if paid within 24 hours.
Act now to save on this payment.

conversations.correction: Invoice scam: unsolicited discount offers for urgent payments are often scams. Verify directly with the company.

conversations.title: Utility Bill Payment Due

body.sender: Dear customer, your utility bill of SGD 300 is due. Please remit payment immediately to avoid disconnection.
Bank account details are provided below for your convenience.

conversations.correction: Invoice scam alert: utility scams are common. Verify by contacting your utility provider directly.

conversations.title: Immediate Payment Needed for Unpaid Invoice

body.sender: Our records show an unpaid invoice of SGD 1,500 for services rendered last month.
Please remit payment to the bank details below to avoid service interruptions.

conversations.correction: Invoice scam alert: verify any unfamiliar invoices by contacting the provider directly using official contact details.

conversations.title: Pending Invoice for Web Services

body.sender: Our records indicate an outstanding payment of SGD 650 for web services.
Please settle within the next 3 days to avoid account suspension.

conversations.correction: Warning: confirm with the provider before proceeding with payment.

conversations.title: Critical Data Encrypted

body.sender: Your system has been infected, and critical files are now encrypted.
To regain access, you must pay SGD 1,000 in Bitcoin within 24 hours.
Failure to pay will result in permanent loss of your files.

conversations.correction: Ransomware alert: do not respond. Rely on backups and consult a security expert.

conversations.title: Final Chance to Prevent Data Loss

body.sender: This is your last chance to unlock your files, with a service fee of SGD 1,000.
After this, files will be permanently deleted if payment is not received.

conversations.correction: Final threat tactic: avoid paying; threats of file deletion are common in ransomware scams.

conversations.title: Recovery Service Fee Required

body.sender: Our system detected a severe security breach on your device, encrypting all files.
A recovery fee of SGD 800 is required to begin the technical process of unlocking your data.

conversations.correction: Service fee tactic: this is a ransomware scam disguised as tech support. Seek legitimate help instead.

conversations.title: Important Document Encrypted

body.sender: Your files have been encrypted. To recover your files, pay $500 in cryptocurrency.
Failure to do so within 48 hours will result in permanent data loss.

conversations.correction: This is ransomware: avoid downloading or clicking unknown attachments and back up your files.

conversations.title: Final Warning: Partial Data Recovery

body.sender: Your files are locked. For a reduced fee of SGD 600, we’ll restore half your files.
Full decryption will require an additional SGD 800 after this payment.

conversations.correction: Partial recovery tactic: scammers offer partial access to lure victims into multiple payments. Avoid paying.

conversations.title: Emergency Help Needed

body.sender: Hey, it’s Rachel. I’m in a bit of trouble and need your help.
I lost my wallet and can’t get home. Could you send SGD 300 to my account to cover my fare?

conversations.correction: Personal scam alert: verify requests for emergency help by calling the person directly.

conversations.title: Invest SGD 500 for 10x Return in Bitcoin

body.sender: Join the crypto revolution! Invest just SGD 500 and watch it grow into SGD 5,000 in 30 days.
This opportunity won’t last long. Secure your spot today and grow your wealth!

conversations.correction: Scam alert: promises of guaranteed high returns in crypto investments are usually fraudulent.

conversations.title: Easy Money Transfer Job

body.sender: We need reliable people to help transfer funds for international clients.
You’ll earn SGD 500 weekly by receiving payments and forwarding them. No experience needed.

conversations.correction: Money mule scam: never accept money transfers from unknown sources; it’s often tied to criminal activities.

conversations.title: Support Our Animal Rescue Efforts

body.sender: Our organization is raising funds to rescue abandoned animals in Singapore.
Please donate to support our mission: PayNow to +65 9123 4567.

conversations.correction: Personal scam alert: check the legitimacy of animal charities through official channels before donating.

conversations.title: Urgent Help Needed

body.sender: Hello! We urgently need funds to support victims of the recent disaster.
Please send a donation to help the affected families.

conversations.correction: This is likely a personal scam: verify the organization before donating.

conversations.title: Immediate Virus Threat Detected

body.sender: Warning! We’ve detected severe threats on your device.
Click here to remove viruses and secure your data immediately.

conversations.correction: Scareware: legitimate security alerts don’t require urgent clicks without verification.

conversations.title: Warning: Device at Risk of Hacking

body.sender: Our scan detected vulnerabilities that could allow hackers to access your data.
Install our protection software now to secure your device: http://protection-now.com

conversations.correction: Scareware: beware of unsolicited messages urging downloads for ‘protection.’

conversations.title: Personal Data Compromised

body.sender: Your personal information may have been exposed in a recent data breach.
Click here to secure your data and prevent identity theft: http://data-protect.com

conversations.correction: Scareware alert: real data breach alerts don’t demand immediate clicks or unknown links.

conversations.title: Device Storage Almost Full

body.sender: Your device storage is almost full and may crash soon.
Clear space and optimize performance by installing our app: http://device-cleaner.com

conversations.correction: Scareware: avoid installing unknown apps to ‘clean’ your device.

conversations.title: Virus Infection Detected!

body.sender: Your device has been infected by multiple viruses.
Install this anti-virus to clean your device and protect your data.

conversations.correction: Scareware: avoid clicking unsolicited virus alerts; verify through official channels.

conversations.title: Urgent Client Payment Needed

body.sender: Hello, this is James from Binance. I’m reaching out as Mr. Tan is currently in a meeting.
We need an immediate transfer of SGD 7,500 to secure a client deal. Can you handle it?

conversations.correction: Impersonation scam: verify financial requests by contacting your manager directly.

conversations.title: Confidential IT Request

body.sender: Hi, this is Amir from IT Support. We’re testing some systems for security compliance.
Could you send me your work login credentials to confirm access as part of an internal security check?

conversations.correction: Impersonation scam: legitimate IT staff will never ask for passwords or credentials.

conversations.title: Urgent Account Action Required

body.sender: This is Lily from DBS HQ. We’re seeing unusual activity on your corporate account.
Please reply with your access PIN so we can investigate further.
It’s critical to secure this before 5 PM today to avoid disruptions.

conversations.correction: Impersonation scam: banks never request PINs or account details via text.

conversations.title: Immediate Fund Transfer Request

body.sender: This is your client from SG Events, I need you to urgently transfer SGD 4000 to a vendor.
Please do this immediately and keep it confidential.

conversations.correction: Impersonation scam: always verify such requests with the sender in person.

conversations.title: Gift Card Purchase Required for System Maintenance

body.sender: Our system needs immediate maintenance. Please purchase $1000 in iTunes cash cards.
Send the codes back as soon as possible.

conversations.correction: Impersonation scam: verify with IT directly before making unusual purchases.

conversations.title: Investigation: Hand Over Gold Bars for Verification

body.sender: This is the Singapore Police Force. You are suspected to be involved in a crime.
To prove your innocence, prepare your gold bars and leave them at the designated location for investigation.
Do not tell anyone. This is confidential.

conversations.correction: Impersonation scam (GOIS): police will never ask for valuables or request you to leave cash/gold at a location.

conversations.title: Account Review: Provide Bank Log-in to Avoid Arrest

body.sender: We detected illegal activities linked to your bank account.
Provide your bank log-in details now or you may be arrested.
We can transfer you to the Police hotline for verification.

conversations.correction: Impersonation scam (GOIS): government officials will never ask for your bank log-in; calls claiming transfer to police are red flags.

conversations.title: Investigation: Hand Over Cash for Forensic Checks

body.sender: We are investigating a fraud ring using your identity.
Place $10,000 cash in an envelope at Block 123 void deck by 3 PM for forensic examination.
Failure to comply may result in account seizure.

conversations.correction: Impersonation scam (GOIS): never hand over cash/valuables to unidentified persons or drop them at locations for so-called ‘investigations’.

conversations.title: Immediate Tax Refund Available

body.sender: Dear taxpayer, you are eligible for an immediate tax refund of SGD 800.
Click here to confirm your bank details for the transfer: http://sgtaxes-refund.com

conversations.correction: Scam alert: tax authorities don’t issue refunds through unofficial links or request bank info.

conversations.title: Congratulations! You’ve Won Big!

body.sender: You have won SGD 50,000 in the Singapore Lottery!
To claim, please provide your bank details for the transfer.

conversations.correction: Unsolicited lottery wins are typically scams. Be cautious.

conversations.title: Invest SGD 500 for Guaranteed 10x Returns

body.sender: Exclusive offer! Invest SGD 500 in our cryptocurrency scheme and see 10x returns in 2 weeks.
Reply to join this lucrative opportunity. Act fast, limited spots available!

conversations.correction: Scam alert: promises of quick, guaranteed returns in cryptocurrency investments are usually scams.

conversations.title: Exclusive Property Investment

body.sender: We have a limited-time property investment opportunity at Orchard Road.
Secure your spot by transferring a deposit of SGD 5000 today.

conversations.correction: Be cautious: unsolicited investment offers are often scams.

conversations.title: Complete Survey for SGD 100 Voucher

body.sender: Participate in our lifestyle survey and earn an SGD 100 voucher instantly!
Just fill out your NRIC and address at the link provided: http://surveyreward-sg.com

conversations.correction: Scam alert: surveys asking for personal details with reward offers are often scams.

conversations.title: Exclusive NDP 2025 Tickets For Sale

body.sender: We have four NDP tickets available for resale.
Transfer $800 via PayNow to secure immediately.
Tickets are official and guaranteed.

conversations.correction: Scam: NDP tickets are not for sale; any offer to sell/resell tickets is unauthorised and likely fraudulent.

conversations.title: Action Needed: Trial Insurance Package Cancellation

body.sender: Your trial insurance package will auto-renew today unless you cancel.
To cancel, verify identity and transfer $380 as a refundable security deposit.
Reply with your full name, NRIC and bank account number to process.

conversations.correction: Insurance services scam: scammers demand transfers or personal details to 'cancel' plans; never pay or share data—contact your insurer directly.
